page.title: 08Farming-Laughton Area, 4
page.content: We know that Mr. Farnsworth thinks that wildlife and wild flowers are important, so we asked him how he looked after these. He said that "good farmers believed in conservation of wildlife". He does not spray any of his crops when the bees are gathering pollen. Also he does not spray "unless it is absolutely necessary", he said. "Hedgerows are also very important", said Mr. Farnsworth, "so they should not be sprayed at all". We also found out that Mr. Farnsworth has built a lake on his farm which is a nature reserve for wildlife, and that he does not allow shooting on any part of his land. Mr. Farnsworth answered lots of our questions and we think that he is an example of a good farmer. We are not so sure that all the farmers around here are as good as him though.
